results.title: Shchors
results.creator_credit: Kiev Film Studio and Oleksandr Petrovych Dovzhenko
results.brief_description:
A depiction of the exploits of the Ukrainian civil war commander Nikolai Shchors (under whom director Dovzhenko served). The film opens during the 1918 German intervention in the civil war. Ukrainians partisans form a brigade known as the Boguns and join with the Tarashchansk regiment to oppose German and Rada forces. Thematically, the film is a heroic mission, a quest and biography of a civil war leader who was a Bolshevik icon. Stalin commissioned this film to be made and took a participatory role in the film’s production and direction. A protracted shoot proved taxing to Dovzhenko who was forced to submit every creative idea and episode for political approval. Despite its socialist-realist approach, the film contains poetic and memorable images typical of Dovzhenko’s style.

Credits: Director, writer, Alexander Dovzhenko ; photography, Y. Ekelchik ; music, Ukrainian State Symphony Orchestra.
Cast: Yevgeni Samoilov, Ivan Skuratov, N. Nikitina, L. Lyashenko.

results.title: Shaw versus Shakespeare. Part 1: the character of Caesar
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: George Bernard Shaw, played by Donald Moffatt, analyses Shakespear’s characterisation of Julis Caesar and compares it with his won treatment. Shaw claims the character of Caesar was beyind Shakespeare, but admits Shakespear is still the “King of the dramatists”.

results.title: Shaun the Sheep
results.brief_description: Shaun the Sheep is a British stop-motion animated children’s television series produced by Aardman Animations, and commissioned by the British Broadcasting Corporation and Westdeutscher Rundfunk, a constituent member of the consortium of German public-broadcasting institutions, ARD. It is a spin-off of the Wallace and Gromit franchise, starring Shaun from A Close Shave as its main protagonist. It first aired in the UK on CBBC in March 2007. The series has also inspired its own spin-off show, Timmy Time, which is aimed at younger viewers. The show has been broadcast in 180 countries around the world.

results.title: Shaun of the Dead
results.brief_description: Shaun lives a supremely uneventful life, which revolves around his girlfriend, his mother, and, above all, his local pub. This gentle routine is threatened when the dead return to life and make strenuous attempts to snack on ordinary Londoners.

constellations_other.name: Blood, shot
constellations_other.description: The fake blood used by costume designer Edie Kurzer in Judy & Punch is connected to a long, bloody lineage in cinema.

results.title: Shaun Gladwell: Stereo Sequences interviews [web excerpt]
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Csilla Csongvay and Jason White
results.brief_description: ‘Shaun Gladwell: Stereo Sequences’ is the first in the ‘New Horizons’ series of ACMI commissions. Gladwell uses filmic devices such as slow-motion and long pans to capture both tightly choreographed and improvised performances by breakdancers, skateboarders and BMX bike riders in a combination of rural and city settings. The resulting works, which he describes as “performative landscapes” are both rhythmic and poetic - distorting speed, gravity, space and time; exploring visual and spatial paradoxes. He discusses his art practice and his collaboration with other performers and artists for this exhibition. Other interviews include; Sarah Tutton (ACMI curator), Josh Raymond (Gladwell producer) Vivienne Wong (Australian Ballet) and Lamaroc (street dancer).

results.title: Shattered Glass
results.creator_credit: Cruise/Wagner Productions, Baumgarten Merims Productions, Forest Park Pictures, Renée April, Craig Baumgarten, Billy Ray, Adam Merims, François Séguin, Gaye Hirsch, Buzz Bissinger and Tove Christensen
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2003
results.brief_description: The true story of fraudulent Washington, D.C. journalist Stephen Glass, who rose to meteoric heights as a young writer in his 20s, becoming a staff writer at The New Republic for three years. Looking for a short cut to fame, Glass concocted sources, quotes and even entire stories, but his deception did not go unnoticed forever, and eventually, his world came crumbling down.

constellations_other.name: Uncovering the truth
constellations_other.description: The images of Tank Man during the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989 were captured by photojournalists and shared around the world. The work of journalists has been key to uncovering abuses of power and are rich material for fictional and factual movies and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Cruise/Wagner Productions, Baumgarten Merims Productions, Forest Park Pictures, Renée April, Craig Baumgarten, Billy Ray, Adam Merims, François Séguin, Gaye Hirsch, Buzz Bissinger and Tove Christensen

results.title: Shattered dreams
results.creator_credit: National Film Board of Canada, Dale Phillips and Wendy Hill-Tout
results.brief_description: Schizophrenia is a disease shrouded in ignorance and myth. This confronting and emotional film details the story of the Martini family who had two sons diagnosed with the disease. Clem Martini, a third brother, narrates the film and through his words we come to understand the grief and pain experienced by the schizophrenics and their families and friends. Passionate and illuminating, “Shattered Dreams” argues for an increased public knowledge of schizophrenia and mental illness.

results.title: Sharpies [a documented history]
results.brief_description: Using Larry Jenkins’ extraordinary and comprehensive photographic archives of the Sharpies throughout the 1970s, this Public Imaging work is an edited collage of photographic materials and provides viewers with a rare insight into this counter cultural grouping. Faces, places, gatherings, gestures and fashion are explored through this rhythmic assemblage of images. The work consists of two sections: one consisting primarily of portraits and social groupings; the second concentrating on details of gestures and adornments representative of Sharpie culture.
